description: Electronic Standing Order - If they have not already done so, all attorneys appearing in this case must file a Certificate Regarding Judge-Specific Requirements on the docket attesting that they have read, and will comply with, the judge-specific requirements for this Court, including the Court's order concerning generative artificial intelligence. The judge-specific requirements and a template Certificate may be found at: Certificate Regarding Judge-Specific Requirements. To file the Certificate, please use the event entitled Certificate Regarding Judge-Specific Requirements. This event is located in the Other Documents selection, which is under the Other Filings category of the Civil page in ECF. Please contact the ECF help desk at 214-753-2633 for filing assistance. (Ordered by Judge Brantley Starr on 6/8/2023) (twd) (Entered: 06/08/2023)

ORDER TO SHOW CAUSE: On or before May 5, 2025, Defendants' counsel shall SHOW CAUSE in writing why this Court should not REFER Christopher I. Kachouroff and Jennifer T. DeMaster to disciplinary proceedings for violations of applicable Rules of Professional Conduct. Counsel will specifically address, under the oath subject to the penalty of perjury, the circumstances surrounding the preparation of the Opposition to Plaintiff's Motion in Limine, including but not limited to whether Defendants were advised and approved of their counsel's use of generative artificial intelligence. No later than May 5, 2025, defense counsel of record SHALL CERTIFY that a copy of this Order has been provided to Defendant Michael Lindell personally. By Judge Nina Y. Wang on 4/23/2025. (norlin, ) [order mailed as directed, please see ECF 310] (Entered: 04/23/2025)

       Plaintiff,

v.

MICHAEL J. LINDELL,

MY PILLOW, INC.,

       Defendants.

Supplemental MEMORANDUM in Support re 7 MOTION for Preliminary Injunction filed by Dale Harris, Jennifer Harris. (Attachments: # 1 Exhibit Exhibit Index, # 2 Original Student Proposal, # 3 Research Assignment National History Day (Blank), # 4 RNH Notes and Outline for script, # 5 Hingham School Committee Policy Manual Policy CHCA Approval of Handbooks and Directives, # 6 Hingham School Committee Policy Manual Policy JI Student Rights and Responsibilities, # 7 Hingham School Committee Policy Manual Policy JIC Student Discipline, # 8 AI slide deck, # 9 AI Expectations, # 10 Revised AI slide deck, # 11 Excerpts from Hingham High School Student Handbook, 2023-2024 (Old Handbook) see Page 25 (does not include artificial intelligence), # 12 Excerpt from Revised Hingham High School Student Handbook, 2024-2025 (New Handbook) see page 24 (does include artificial intelligence), # 13 Affidavit of Bree Dusseault, # 14 AP US History Class Expectations Susan Petrie, # 15 Article: CDS Adopts Generative AI Assistance Policy Boston University, www.bu.edu/cds/faculty/2023/03/24-cds-adopts-generative-ai-chatgpt-policy/ (last visited 10/17/24), # 16 Affidavit of Pamela Roth, # 17 GCPS Human-Centered Artificial Intelligence (AI) - Gwinnett County Public Schools, # 18 ABC Guide to Ethical and Responsible Use of AI - PUBLIC)(Farrell, Peter) (Entered: 10/18/2024)

Academic Dishonesty
Any student who has chosen to plagiarize or unknowingly plagiarized can receive a failing grade for the
term and/or course. Many cases of plagiarism stem from misunderstandings about how to use sources
correctly, how to paraphrase, etc. You are here to learn. As your teacher I am here to set the context for
you to learn. If you are unsure about whether or not you might be plagiarizing please talk to me before
you submit the paper. If you plagiarize, intentionally or unintenti

description: Order on Artificial Intelligence entered on 6/8/2023: ORDERED that any submission in a case assigned to Judge Vaden that contains text drafted with the assistance of a generative artificial intelligence program on the basis of natural language prompts, including but not limited to ChatGPT and Google Bard, must be accompanied by: (1) A disclosure notice that identifies the program used and the specific portions of text that have been so drafted; (2) A certification that the use of such program has not resulted in the disclosure of any confidential or business proprietary information to any unauthorized party; and it is further ORDERED that, following the filing of such notice, any party may file with the Court any motion provided for by statute or the Rules of the Court of International Trade seeking any relief the party believes the facts disclosed warrant. SO ORDERED. (SEE ORDER FOR FULL DETAILS) (Chien, Jason) (Entered: 06/08/2023)

ORDER- The Court DENIES Thornocks motion for reconsideration. (ECF No. 66 .) Moving forward, the Court will only consider filings drafted by a licensed attorney or filings drafted by Rebecca Thornock herself, with the help of artificial intelligence if she so chooses. subject to the requirements set forth in the Courts March 17, 2025 Order, (see ECF No. 24, at 2). Further, if Thornock appears before the Court at any hearing, she must appear at counsels table either by herself or with retained counsel who is admitted to practice before this Court. The Court WARNS Thornock that failure to comply with this Order may result in sanctions. SEE ORDER FOR DETAILS. Signed by District Judge John A. Gibney, Jr. on 4/16/2025. Copy mailed to Plaintiff. (adun, ) (Entered: 04/16/2025)
